channel.title: Vista's Failure. Good or Bad
channel.description: I was thinking, like windows 2003 and windows 2000, they've been neglected and all the updates, are towards newer versions like XP and Vista. Now, I doubt I would ever afford to upgrade to Vista (even if I wanted to) so I worried if I would fall behind, and all the new PC games coming out later, wouldn't be made available to me. But, Vista, as it turns out, was an epic fail and everyone hated it, the people at Apple had a party, when they found the negative responses to Vista. Microsoft, is aware, they just try to fix things, but it isn't gonna have a mass change any time soon. They would need to work hard on it. So, it shows that many of people are switching back to XP and lots of games, that I thought would be unavailable, later released that they would be working on XP aswell.

item.dc:creator: @goatee goatee
item.description:
@goatee wrote:

Thug-life:

Even Microsoft admit it has some resource problems, i previously defended vista as it wasn’t as bad as people say. It runs reasonably well on my computer… untill i installed one of the updates, now i can’t go 5 minutes without windows explorer crashing.

Really? I don’t update mine lol.

item.title: Vista's Failure. Good or Bad
item.dc:creator: @goatee goatee
item.description:
@goatee wrote:

The only problems I’ve had with Vista are the access issues. It seems so unsure of itself and the user that it asks for permission to do everything.

Vista never failed, it just got a bad reputation because easily persuaded idiots read a post/blog/article that said it was crap and instantly beleived it.

Read full topic

item.title: Vista's Failure. Good or Bad
item.dc:creator: @Unhandled Unhandled
item.description:
@Unhandled wrote:

pk4pk:

I belive there will be a new operating system in the future. Not by microsoft. But, more user friendly then linux, more secure, faster, and wastes little ram. (Way more user friendly) And, maybe, a built in security program…with firewall.

Tell me what isn’t user friendly about Linux (specifically K/Ubuntu which aims to be noob user friendly).
Tell me how Linux isn’t secure, how it isn’t fast, and how it wastes ram. Also, Linux HAS a built in firewall.
